description: Domain-anchored learning backlog - domain drift prevented via domain_anchor.py scoring

tasks.description: Research: Rx + WPF data binding synchronization patterns
tasks.reason: Bridges Rx streams with WPF UI binding for reactive data flow. Essential for implementing Tickblaze's real-time market data updates directly to UI. Connects LEARN-007 Rx patterns with WPF rendering.

tasks.description: Research: WPF UI virtualization techniques for large datasets
tasks.reason: DynamicData research mentioned virtualization operators and VirtualizingPanel for 10,000+ item collections. Understanding proper implementation of UI virtualization extends reactive collection knowledge into rendering optimization critical for trading platform performance. Connects to LEARN-027 reactive collections.

tasks.description: Research: WPF Dispatcher and thread affinity for UI Automation
tasks.reason: WeakEventManager uses read/write locks for thread safety. Understanding Dispatcher threading model is critical for WPF testing where automation runs on different threads than UI.

tasks.description: Research: UI Automation (UIA) event monitoring with AccEvent tool for testing dynamic content in WPF applications
tasks.reason: Bridges gap in automated accessibility testing (30-40% coverage requiring manual work); critical for WPF trading platforms with live data streams. Mentioned 3+ times in WinAppDriver/Axe.Windows research as necessary for dynamic content validation. Domain anchor score: 10/10 (core: UI Automation, WPF, testing).

tasks.description: Research: WinAppDriver integration with Axe.Windows for accessibility testing automation
tasks.reason: Mentioned as recommended approach for driving Windows application state during Axe.Windows accessibility scans in CI/CD pipelines. Bridges automated testing (FlaUI/WinAppDriver) with accessibility compliance. Essential for implementing automated accessibility regression testing in Tickblaze.
tasks.domain_score: 10/10 - Strong core domain relevance (automation + accessibility testing)

tasks.description: Research: WPF UI Automation thread affinity and synchronization
tasks.reason: Thread affinity enforcement is a core concept in WPF Dispatcher research, and UI Automation must also respect thread affinity when querying or manipulating UI elements from test automation

tasks.description: Research: WPF CompositionTarget.Rendering optimization patterns
tasks.reason: Recommended as best solution for high-speed property updates in trading apps, mentioned as 30-60Hz natural frequency, directly applicable to Tickblaze, fills gap in understanding how to implement properly with thread safety

tasks.description: Research: AutomationPeer custom implementation patterns for WPF controls
tasks.reason: Core to event raising and UI Automation support - OnCreateAutomationPeer, pattern implementation, and ListenerExists optimization mentioned throughout AccEvent research

tasks.description: Research: CPU Affinity and Thread Scheduling Optimization for Low-Latency Systems
tasks.reason: Critical gap: implementation of CPU pinning and cache locality for lock-free patterns. Essential for extracting full performance from application-level optimizations in real trading systems. [Domain score: 6/10 - related via performance optimization for trading]

tasks.description: Research: .NET Garbage Collection tuning for low-latency WPF applications
tasks.reason: Lock-free ring buffers and CPU affinity research mentions GC pauses as latency killers (pre-allocate memory, no GC). Understanding Server vs Workstation GC modes, background GC, LOH compaction, and GCLatencyMode settings is critical for optimizing Tickblaze WPF trading platform performance. Direct connection to existing WPF and low-latency research.

tasks.description: Research: PerfView and ETW event tracing for WPF applications
tasks.reason: GC tuning research heavily referenced ETW events for measuring pause times (26μs suspension, 4.8ms collection, 21μs resumption). PerfView provides ground truth for GC behavior, memory allocation, and rendering performance. Essential measurement tool that enables validation of ALL WPF performance optimizations.
tasks.domain_score: 8/10 - Core domain (essential measurement tool for WPF trading performance)

tasks.description: Research: WPF visual tree optimization techniques and complexity reduction
tasks.reason: PerfView research identified visual tree complexity as consuming 70% of performance budget (70ms in 100ms target). This is a core WPF performance bottleneck directly relevant to Tickblaze trading UI.

tasks.description: Research: WeakEventManager patterns and memory leak prevention in WPF
tasks.reason: Mentioned repeatedly in visual tree optimization - provides 15-30% memory reduction and prevents common event handler leaks. Critical for long-running WPF applications.
tasks.domain_score: 9/10 - Core domain (WPF memory management, testing long-running apps)

tasks.description: Research: WPF DependencyProperty optimization patterns (validation callbacks, coercion, Freezable objects)
tasks.reason: CPU affinity research mentions cache-line awareness and memory access patterns. DependencyProperty callbacks execute on every property change in WPF data binding - understanding optimization patterns (avoiding validation in hot paths, freezing Freezable objects, coercion vs validation) directly impacts Tickblaze UI responsiveness during high-frequency market data updates. Core WPF performance primitive.

tasks.description: Research: WPF resource dictionary optimization and StaticResource vs DynamicResource performance
tasks.reason: Freezable XAML pattern showed PresentationOptions:Freeze with StaticResource usage - need to understand when StaticResource vs DynamicResource impacts performance, especially for frozen Freezable objects in trading platform themes
tasks.domain_score: 10/10 - Strong core domain relevance (WPF + performance optimization)

tasks.description: Research: Research: WPF PresentationOptions:Freeze implementation and compile-time resource freezing patterns
tasks.reason: Mentioned in LEARN-045 and LEARN-046 as critical for freezing Freezable objects in XAML (212 bytes vs 972 bytes memory savings). Required for DynamicResource with Brushes to prevent unfrozen resource bugs. Direct compile-time technique for enforcing immutability and thread safety.
tasks.domain_score: 10/10 - Strong core domain relevance (WPF + performance optimization)

tasks.description: Research: WPF visual tree rendering optimization and composition system internals
tasks.reason: Petzold findings show 10,000x performance difference between frozen/unfrozen objects due to composition system change notification. Understanding this is critical for rendering performance.

tasks.description: Research: WPF DrawingVisual implementation patterns for high-performance rendering
tasks.reason: ItemContainerStyle/DataTemplate research recommends DrawingVisual as best approach for large datasets (10k+ items) with 5% CPU updates vs 10% for standard templates. Directly applicable to Tickblaze Time & Sales and chart data.

tasks.description: Research: WPF routed events and visual tree event routing patterns
tasks.reason: Hit testing research showed DrawingVisual host containers handle events. Understanding event routing through visual tree (bubbling/tunneling) is essential for custom control event handling and complements hit testing knowledge.

tasks.description: Research: WPF UI Automation frameworks (FlaUI, White, Microsoft UI Automation) - architecture comparison
tasks.reason: Mentioned 3x in routed events research - frameworks rely on event routing and visual tree traversal. KB lacks automation framework comparison.

tasks.description: Research: WPF Dispatcher threading models and multi-dispatcher architectures
tasks.reason: CodeProject trading app uses multiple dispatchers per view to prevent UI freezing - core pattern for high-performance trading platforms with concurrent data feeds
tasks.domain_score: 8/10 - Core domain focus (WPF threading for trading platforms)

tasks.description: Research: Research: WPF AttachedBehavior patterns for UI Automation test helpers
tasks.reason: Thread affinity research showed automation peers require UI thread access. AttachedBehaviors can encapsulate Dispatcher.InvokeAsync patterns into reusable test helpers, simplifying cross-thread UI manipulation in test automation code. Bridges MVVM attached property patterns with automation testing infrastructure.

tasks.description: Research: FlaUI library practical testing patterns and best practices
tasks.reason: AttachedBehavior research mentioned FlaUI as modern WPF testing framework - need practical patterns for element finding, wait strategies, pattern-based testing
tasks.domain_score: 10/10 - Core domain focus (WPF testing, UI Automation)

tasks.description: Research: WPF UI virtualization techniques for ItemsControl with large datasets
tasks.reason: Referenced in AutomationPeer research - DynamicData and observable collections can have 10,000+ items requiring virtualization for performance while maintaining automation support

tasks.description: Research: WPF Dispatcher priority and threading models for real-time market data updates
tasks.reason: GC tuning research mentioned thread isolation and dispatcher queue monitoring as critical for real-time WPF, and trading apps need coordinated UI updates during market data floods

tasks.description: Research: WPF CompositionTarget.Rendering for synchronized real-time market data updates
tasks.reason: Referenced 4x in Dispatcher research as critical for trading platforms - synchronizes UI updates with monitor refresh rate (30-60 Hz) to achieve smooth 60 FPS visual throughput. Decoples data arrival from rendering loop. Core WPF rendering mechanism.
tasks.domain_score: 8/10 - Core domain (WPF + rendering optimization for trading UI)

tasks.description: Research: WPF ItemContainerStyle and DataTemplate performance optimization patterns
tasks.reason: Multiple sources mentioned template complexity (3-5 elements max) and the ItemContainerGenerator. Understanding how to optimize DataTemplates and ItemContainerStyles is critical for maintaining virtualization performance.

tasks.description: Research: WPF visual layer hit testing patterns for custom controls
tasks.reason: DrawingVisual requires manual hit testing - need to understand geometry-based hit testing for trading UI interactions
tasks.domain_score: 10/10 - Strong core domain relevance (WPF, custom controls, trading UI, testing)

tasks.description: Research: WPF DispatcherSynchronizationContext and custom SynchronizationContext implementation patterns
tasks.reason: Reed Copsey and Microsoft docs emphasized SynchronizationContext.SetSynchronizationContext requirement before window creation in multi-threaded scenarios - critical for BackgroundWorker and TaskScheduler compatibility. Understanding custom SynchronizationContext implementations extends multi-dispatcher knowledge and bridges async/await patterns with WPF threading.
tasks.domain_score: [Core learning (first 3 topics)] Score 8/10 - Core domain focus (mentions: WPF)

tasks.description: Research: Research: ReactiveUI MessageBus and inter-ViewModel communication patterns for WPF
tasks.reason: Rx + WPF research mentioned ViewModel-to-ViewModel binding as advanced pattern. MessageBus enables loosely-coupled communication between reactive ViewModels essential for modular trading platform UI (order entry triggering position updates, chart selection updating watchlist, etc.). Fills gap in practical patterns for coordinating multiple reactive ViewModels without tight coupling.

tasks.description: Research: ReactiveCommand composition and enablement patterns
tasks.reason: Mentioned in MessageBus research - cross-ViewModel command coordination, validation, and composition patterns are fundamental to ReactiveUI MVVM

tasks.description: Research: ReactiveUI Interactions pattern for testable dialogs and user confirmations
tasks.reason: ReactiveCommand research mentioned Interactions as preferred pattern over MessageBus for user interactions. Critical for testing dialog workflows in WPF automation. Provides testable abstraction for View-driven operations like confirmations, file pickers, etc.
tasks.domain_score: 10/10 - Core domain (ReactiveUI testing patterns for WPF automation)

tasks.description: Research: Direct2D interop with WPF for high-performance custom rendering
tasks.reason: Composition system research showed WPF uses 3 draw calls per ellipse vs Direct2D uses 1 for 9 ellipses. D2D interop provides 6-9x rendering efficiency for performance-critical custom controls in trading UIs like charts and time/sales displays.
tasks.domain_score: 10/10 - Strong core domain relevance (WPF, custom controls, trading UI)
